thread.title: Cedar Point park roller coaster hits and kills park patronTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Cedar Point park roller coaster hits and kills park patronTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Cedar Point park roller coaster hits and kills park patronTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Cedar Point park roller coaster hits and kills park patron Published on : Friday, August 14, 2015
A man lost his life after being hit by a roller coaster at the Cedar Point’s Sandusky, Ohio, amusement park on early Thursday evening. The deceased has been identified as James A. Young II of East Canton aged 45.
Young had been at the park with friends when he hopped on the Raptor around 5 p.m. Young jumped over a fence into a restricted area under the Raptor to look for his things which he lost. He was struck by the Raptor train that was in operation.
According to Cedar Point spokesman Bryan Edwards, “Park safety officials responded immediately to the situation. Unfortunately, the guest has passed away.”
Cedar Point is North America’s second oldest continually operated amusement park and has attracted legions of visitors since opening 146 years ago.
Raptor is one of Cedar Park’s 17 coasters, twisting people up, down and all around at speeds reaching 57 mph,
